author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin commented Breakfast bust-up as Euro-sceptic Andrew Bridgen clashes with...
text:
Breakfast bust-up as Euro-sceptic Andrew Bridgen clashes with pro-EU Tory Alec Shelbrooke By danjmartin | Posted: May 26, 2016 Mr Bridgen and Mr Shelbrooke Breakfast bust-up as Euro-sceptic Andrew Bridgen clashes with pro-EU Tory Alec... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (1) 
Arch Euro-sceptic North West Leicestershire MP Andrew Bridgen "came close to blows" with a pro-EU Tory colleague in a confrontation in Parliament, it has been reported. 
Mr Bridgen is said to have clashed with Alec Shelbrooke in the Members' Tea Room in the Palace of Westminster. 
The Times has reported an argument between the pair happened at breakfast on Wednesday. 
The newspaper said shocked Tory and SNP MPs witnessed the incident in which Mr Shelbrooke, MP for Elmet and Rothell in Yorkshire, was shouting 'like a Harpy' while Mr Bridgen mocked the size of his rival's large cooked breakfast. 
The clash, understood to have prompted a complaint to Tory whips, is thought to have been triggered by Mr Bridgen welcoming a poll showing the remain and leave campaigns were neck and neck as the June 23 referendum approaches and stating Prime Minister David Cameron's credibility had been blown. 
Read more: Brexit would not cost Melton Mowbray Pork Pies protected status says pro-EU expert 
The paper reports Mr Bridgen was eating a boiled egg when Mr Shelbrooke, dining nearby remarked that Leave campaigners had 'had it all their own way until now' but were now getting it from the Prime Minister and just don't like it. 
Mr Bridgen is said to have objected to vocal remain supporter Mr Shelbrooke's tone and volume and a bad tempered argument followed which then turned personal. 
Mr Bridgen is reported to have told Mr Shelbrooke: "When I saw your breakfast I thought you had invited your entire office" adding "Watch your fingers when you are eating the sausage sandwich because they are going to fall out." 
Mr Bridgen told the Mercury: "It was very unpleasant. 
"I am big enough and ugly enough to deal with it but there were lady members present who were very upset. 
"It just shows that there are real tension in our party over that this issue. 
"It is the most important vote any of us will make." 
The Mercury attempted to contact Mr Shelbrooke but his office did not respond.
